creator: mops@students.zcu.cz
text:
Hello.

I have just installed Apache 1.3.28 on my Win98 (from the MSI binary on 
httpd.apache.org).

When I try to start apache I get only a message window telling me that the 
library WIN9XCONHOOK.DLL was not found.

I have found that there is file WIN9XC~1.DLL in the apache directory.
When I have renamed this file to WIN9XCONHOOK.DLL, apache server started 
without error. I think there is some problem with long file name in 
installation process.

It seems that the only problem was that short filename.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text: Seems to be resolved. No one else claimed about such a problem...
